channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report E-2024060048
item.description:
Report E-2024060048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: SHREWSBURY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWO experienced a UN2582 Hydrex 3250 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct a tote transfer. Terminal personnel conducting initial cleanup of 1-gallon. Contractors arrived onsite and transferred the material from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted pads and PPE into a cubic yard box. All rinse water used to decontaminate the tote and pump were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050740
item.description:
Report E-2024050740

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT CHEMICAL, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HT driver stated that once he hooked up to take his paper work to his tractor when he heard a popping sound. Driver also stated that the when he was opening the external valve the handle felt different and it felt like it was coming out further than it should so he stopped opening He went to the back of the trailer and noticed the external valve had came out completely. He then went and hit the emergency valve but product continued to flow out until it finally stopped. HT notified the customer o the spill and the operator returned to the unloading area where he saw the external valve on the ground. HT driver had some product on his clothes and face. He was taken to the hospital for observation. HT driver did not have his hard hat on or face shield at the time

item.title: Report X-2024060492
item.description:
Report X-2024060492

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SOUTH SORT AISLE. THE SORTER NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE SIDE OF THE BOX. THERE WAS A MILD ODOR COMING FROM IT. HE STOPPED, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED DMP SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. DETERMIND TO BE A POSSILE UNDECLARED SHIPMENT.
